Package sait.bms.managers

Class Manager

  • java.lang.Object
    • sait.bms.managers.Manager
  • public class Manager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manager class to display the following: Displays the menu of options Checkout a Book Find Books by Title Display Books by Type Produces a Random Book List Saves changes & Exits the program
    Author:
    Mahdiyeh abbaspour 5:56:19 a.m. Feb. 5, 2022

      Allows a patron to checkout a book

      Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type.
      void findBooksbyTitle​(java.util.Scanner sc)
      Prompts the user patron to enter a title, performs a case-insensitive search of books that containing the inputted title, and displays them.

    • Method Detail

      • menu

        public void menu​(java.util.Scanner sc)
          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Displays the menu of options
        Parameters:
        sc - standard scanner object, which is passed to all of the methods
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file cannot be found

      • loadBooksListFromFile

        public java.util.ArrayList<Book> loadBooksListFromFile()
                                                throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Loads the books from an input file into a list.
        Returns:
        Arraylist loaded from the txt file containing the books
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file cannot be found.

      • CheckoutBook

        public void CheckoutBook​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Allows a patron to checkout a book
        Parameters:
        sc - to read the ISBN of the book from the reader

      • findBooksbyTitle

        public void findBooksbyTitle​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Prompts the user patron to enter a title, performs a case-insensitive search of books that containing the inputted title, and displays them.
        Parameters:
        sc - to read the title of the book from the user

      • displayBooksbyType

        public void displayBooksbyType​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Allows a patron to view a list of books with a specific type. The user will also enter a format, diet, genre, or frequency (depending on the type of book) and the book list will be narrowed down further.
        Parameters:
        sc - to read the inputs from the user

      • produceRandomBookList

        public void produceRandomBookList​(java.util.Scanner sc)
        Prompts the user to enter a number and the program displays that number of random books. The books can be any type.
        Parameters:
        sc - to read the inputs from the user

      • SaveAndExit

        public void SaveAndExit()
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Saves the changes done throughout the program
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file containing the books was not found
